document_data.caption: Various nunchaku.
document_data.name: Nunchaku
document_data.mainbody: '''Nunchaku''' ({{Pronounce|Nun|chah|koo|refs = }}) were a type of exotic melee weapon typically used by [[monk]]s.
document_data.Description: The nunchaku was made of two hardwood wands or dowels, {{SIrange|12|14|in|long=yes}} long and {{SI|1|in}} in diameter, connected at one end by a stout leather cord or a metal chain.{{Cite dragon/61/Or with a weird one|22}}
document_data.Weaponology:
It took special training, such as monks received, to use this exotic weapon effectively in melee combat.

Nunchaku could be used to disarm an opponent much like the [[flail]]. Monks could take full advantage of this quick, bludgeoning weapon.

Notable Wielders of Nunchaku.Groups:
* Nunchaku were a favored weapon of the [[cleric]]s of [[Waukeen]]. The goddess herself wielded a ''nunchaku'' in the form of a ''[[cloud of coins]]''.<ref>
* Nunchaku were one of the few weapons the [[monk]]s of the [[Disciples of the White Rod]] order were known to fight with. The ones they fought with had leather wrappings on their hilts that were bleached white.{{Cite web enhancement/Deity Do's and Don'ts|7}}
